Zangoose.description: Memories of battling its archrival Seviper are etched into every cell of Zangoose's body. This Pokémon adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.

Zigzagoon.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionZigzagoon restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This Pokémon does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.

Abomasnow.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionIt lives a quiet life on mountains that are perpetually covered in snow. It hides itself by whipping up blizzards.

Ambipom.description: It uses its tails for everything. If it wraps both of its tails around you and gives you a squeeze, that's proof it really likes you.

Arceus.description: It is told in mythology that this Pokémon was born before the universe even existed.

Azelf.description: It is thought that Uxie, Mesprit, and Azelf all came from the same egg.

Bastiodon.description: This Pokémon is from roughly 100 million years ago. Its terrifyingly tough face is harder than steel.

Bibarel.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

Bidoof.description: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

Bonsly.description: If its body gets too damp, it will die. So, in a process reminiscent of sweating, its eyes expel moisture.

Bronzong.description: Ancient people believed that petitioning Bronzong for rain was the way to make crops grow.

Bronzor.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

Budew.description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

Buizel.description: It inflates the flotation sac around its neck and pokes its head out of the water to see what is going on.

Buneary.description: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it's attacked by an enemy.

Burmy.description: If its cloak is broken in battle, it quickly remakes the cloak with materials nearby.

Carnivine.description: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

Chatot.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

Cherrim.description: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

Cherubi.description: It evolves by sucking the energy out of the small ball where it had been storing nutrients.

Chimchar.description: The gas made in its belly burns from its rear end. The fire burns weakly when it feels sick.

Chingling.description: There is an orb inside its mouth. When it hops, the orb bounces all over and makes a ringing sound.

Combee.description: It collects and delivers honey to its colony. At night, they cluster to form a beehive and sleep.

Cranidos.description: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

Cresselia.description: Those who sleep holding Cresselia's feather are assured of joyful dreams. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

Croagunk.description: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

Darkrai.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

Dialga.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

Drapion.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

Drifblim.description: The raw material for the gas inside its body is souls. When its body starts to deflate, it's thought to carry away people and Pokémon.

Drifloon.description: Wandering souls gathered together to form this Pokémon. When trying to make friends with children, Drifloon grabs them by the hand.

Dusknoir.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

Electivire.description: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

Empoleon.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

Finneon.description: It lures in prey with its shining tail fins. It stays near the surface during the day and moves to the depths when night falls.

Floatzel.description: Its flotation sac developed as a result of pursuing aquatic prey. It can double as a rubber raft.

Froslass.description: It's said that on nights of terrible blizzards, it comes down to human settlements. If you hear it knocking at your door, do not open it!

Gabite.description: It sheds its skin and gradually grows larger. Its scales can be ground into a powder and used as raw materials for traditional medicine.

Gallade.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionA master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

Garchomp.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionIts fine scales don't just reduce wind resistance—their sharp edges also cause injury to any opponent who attacks it.

Gastrodon.description: Their shape and color change, depending on their environment and diet. There are many of them at beaches where the waves are calm.

Gible.description: Its original home is an area much hotter than Alola. If you're planning to live with one, your heating bill will soar.

Giratina.description: It was banished for its violence. It silently gazed upon the old world from the Distortion World.

Glaceon.description: It can instantaneously freeze any moisture that's around it, creating ice pellets to shoot at its prey.

Glameow.description: When it's happy, Glameow demonstrates beautiful movements of its tail, like a dancing ribbon.

Gliscor.description: Its flight is soundless. It uses its lengthy tail to carry off its prey... Then its elongated fangs do the rest.

Grotle.description: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

Happiny.description: When it sees something round and white, Happiny puts it into the pouch on its stomach. It sometimes becomes overloaded and can't move.

Heatran.description: Boiling blood, like magma, circulates through its body. It makes its dwelling place in volcanic caves.

Hippopotas.description: It enshrouds itself with sand to protect itself from germs. It does not enjoy getting wet.

Hippowdon.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

Honchkrow.description: Its goons take care of most of the fighting for it. The only time it dirties its own hands is in delivering a final blow to finish off an opponent.

Infernape.description: It tosses its enemies around with agility. It uses all its limbs to fight in its own unique style.

Kricketot.description: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

Kricketune.description: It signals its emotions with its melodies. Scientists are studying these melodic patterns.

Leafeon.description: It gets its nutrition from photosynthesis. It lives a quiet life deep in forests where clean rivers flow.

Lickilicky.description: It uses its tongue much more skillfully than its hands or its feet. It can deftly pick up a single small bean with its tongue.

Lopunny.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionIt's notably wary and has a dislike of fighting, but at the same time, it can deliver powerful kicks with its lithe legs.

Lucario.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionLucario reads its opponent's feelings with its aura waves. It finds out things it would rather not know, so it gets stressed out easily.

Lumineon.description: They traverse the deep waters as if crawling over the seafloor. The fantastic lights of its fins shine like stars in the night sky.

Luxio.description: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

Luxray.description: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

Magmortar.description: Magmortar takes down its enemies by shooting fireballs, which burn them to a blackened crisp. It avoids this method when hunting prey.

Magnezone.description: There are still people who believe that this Pokémon came from outer space. It emanates a powerful magnetic field.

Mamoswine.description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

Manaphy.description: It starts its life with a wondrous power that permits it to bond with any kind of Pokémon.

Mantyke.description: Mantyke are friendly toward people and will approach boats closely. The patterns on their backs differ depending on their habitat.

Mesprit.description: It sleeps at the bottom of a lake. Its spirit is said to leave its body to fly on the lake's surface.

Mime Jr..description: When this gifted mimic surprises an opponent, Mime Jr. feels so happy that it ends up forgetting it was imitating something.

Mismagius.description: Its muttered curses can cause awful headaches or terrifying visions that torment others.

Monferno.description: It uses ceilings and walls to launch aerial attacks. Its fiery tail is but one weapon.

Mothim.description: It flutters around at night and steals honey from the Combee hive.

Munchlax.description: Anything that looks edible, Munchlax will go on and swallow whole. Its stomach is tough enough to handle it even if the food has gone rotten.

Pachirisu.description: A pair may be seen rubbing their cheek pouches together in an effort to share stored electricity.

Palkia.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

Phione.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

Piplup.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

Porygon-Z.description: A faulty update was added to its programming. Its behavior is noticeably strange, so the experiment may have been a failure.

Prinplup.description: It lives a solitary life. Its wings deliver wicked blows that can snap even the thickest of trees.

Probopass.description: It uses three small units to catch prey and battle enemies. The main body mostly just gives orders.

Purugly.description: To make itself appear intimidatingly beefy, it tightly cinches its waist with its twin tails.

Rampardos.description: This ancient Pokémon used headbutts skillfully. Its brain was really small, so some theories suggest that its stupidity led to its extinction.

Regigigas.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

Rhyperior.description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. Geodude are shot at rare times.

Riolu.description: It uses waves called auras to communicate with others of its kind. It doesn't make any noise during this time, so its enemies can't detect it.

Roserade.description: With the movements of a dancer, it strikes with whips that are densely lined with poison thorns.

Rotom.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

Shaymin.description: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

Shellos.description: When it senses danger, a purple liquid oozes out of it. The liquid is thought to be something like greasy sweat.

Shieldon.description: Although its fossils can be found in layers of primeval rock, nothing but its face has ever been discovered.

Shinx.description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

Skorupi.description: It burrows under the sand to lie in wait for prey. Its tail claws can inject its prey with a savage poison.

Skuntank.description: It sprays a stinky fluid from its tail. The fluid smells worse the longer it is allowed to fester.

Snover.description: In the spring, it grows berries with the texture of frozen treats around its belly.

Spiritomb.description: It was bound to a fissure in an odd keystone as punishment for misdeeds 500 years ago.

Staraptor.description: When Staravia evolve into Staraptor, they leave the flock to live alone. They have sturdy wings.

Staravia.description: It lives in forests and fields. Squabbles over territory occur when flocks collide.

Starly.description: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

Stunky.description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

Tangrowth.description: Its vines grow so profusely that, in the warm season, you can't even see its eyes.

Togekiss.description: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

Torterra.description: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

Toxicroak.description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

Turtwig.description: It undertakes photosynthesis with its body, making oxygen. The leaf on its head wilts if it is thirsty.

Uxie.description: It is said that its emergence gave humans the intelligence to improve their quality of life.

Vespiquen.description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by Combee.

Weavile.description: Thanks to its increased intelligence, scrapping over food is a thing of the past. A scratch from its claws will give you a case of frostbite!

Wormadam.description: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon's body. The cloak is never shed.

Yanmega.description: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

Accelgor.description: When its body dries out, it weakens. So, to prevent dehydration, it wraps itself in many layers of thin membrane.

Alomomola.description: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.

Amoonguss.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

Archen.description: Restored from a fossil, this ancient bird Pokémon has wings but can't yet fly.

Archeops.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, the muscles it uses to flap its wings are still weak, so it needs a long runway in order to take off.

Audino.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionIt touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

Axew.description: They mark their territory by leaving gashes in trees with their tusks. If a tusk breaks, a new one grows in quickly.

Basculin.description: When a school of Basculin appears in a lake, everything else disappears, except for Corphish and Crawdaunt. That's how violent Basculin are.

Beartic.description: It freezes its breath to create fangs and claws of ice to fight with. Cold northern areas are its habitat.

Beheeyem.description: It has strong psychic powers. Using its fingers that flash three different colors, it controls its opponents and rewrites their memories.

Bisharp.description: It leads a group of Pawniard. Bisharp doesn't even change its expression when it deals the finishing blow to an opponent.

Blitzle.description: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.

Boldore.description: Its orange crystals are lumps of powerful energy. They're valuable, so Boldore is sometimes targeted for them.

Bouffalant.description: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

Braviary.description: Known as “the hero of the skies," this Pokémon is so proud and so brave that it will never retreat, even when it's injured.

Carracosta.description: Carracosta eats every last bit of the prey it catches, even the shells and bones, to further strengthen its sturdy shell.

Chandelure.description: The spirits burned up in its ominous flame lose their way and wander this world forever.

Cinccino.description: The oil that seeps from its body is really smooth. For people troubled by bad skin, this oil is an effective treatment.

Cobalion.description: It has a body and heart of steel. It worked with its allies to punish people when they hurt Pokémon.

Cofagrigus.description: Grave robbers who mistake them for real coffins and get too close end up trapped inside their bodies.

Conkeldurr.description: Rather than rely on force, they master moves that utilize the centrifugal force of spinning concrete.

Cottonee.description: When attacked, it expels cotton from its body to create a diversion. The cotton it loses grows back in quickly.

Crustle.description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

Cryogonal.description: They are composed of ice crystals. They capture prey with chains of ice, freezing the prey at -148 degrees Fahrenheit.

Cubchoo.description: Their snot is a barometer of health. When healthy, their snot is sticky and the power of their ice moves increases.

Darmanitan.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

Darumaka.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionWhen it sleeps, it pulls its limbs into its body and its internal fire goes down to 1,100 degrees Fahrenheit.

Deerling.description: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon's fur. People use it to mark the seasons.

Deino.description: Lacking sight, it's unaware of its surroundings, so it bumps into things and eats anything that moves.

Dewott.description: As a result of strict training, each Dewott learns different forms for using the scalchops.

Drilbur.description: By spinning its body, it can dig straight through the ground at a speed of 30 mph.

Druddigon.description: It infiltrates tunnels that Pokémon like Diglett and Dugtrio have dug and quietly waits for prey to pass through.

Ducklett.description: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.

Duosion.description: When their two divided brains think the same thoughts, their psychic power is maximized.

Durant.description: They attack in groups, covering themselves in steel armor to protect themselves from Heatmor.

Dwebble.description: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

Eelektrik.description: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

Eelektross.description: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.

Elgyem.description: This Pokémon is shrouded in mystery. It's said to have appeared from a UFO that fell from the sky about 50 years ago.

Emboar.description: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.

Emolga.description: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That's why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

Escavalier.description: These Pokémon evolve by wearing the shell covering of a Shelmet. The steel armor protects their whole body.

Excadrill.description: More than 300 feet below the surface, they build mazelike nests. Their activity can be destructive to subway tunnels.

Ferroseed.description: It absorbs the iron it finds in the rock while clinging to the ceiling. It shoots spikes when in danger.

Ferrothorn.description: They attach themselves to cave ceilings, firing steel spikes at targets passing beneath them.

Foongus.description: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball, then releases poison spores.

Fraxure.description: A broken tusk will not grow back, so it diligently sharpens its tusks on river rocks after the end of a battle.

Frillish.description: Using the invisible poison spikes on its veillike arms and legs, it paralyzes its enemies and causes them to drown.

Galvantula.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

Garbodor.description: Some say the reason Garbodor in Alola are a little stronger than their counterparts elsewhere is the presence of Muk, their natural enemy.

Genesect.description: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

Gigalith.description: It absorbs rays of sunlight and shoots out energy. It's usually lurking deep beneath the surface.

Golett.description: Although ancient people apparently built it by working with clay, the source of its energy is unclear.

Golurk.description: When the seal on its chest is removed, it rages indiscriminately, turning the whole town around it into a mountain of rubble.

Gothita.description: They intently observe both Trainers and Pokémon. Apparently, they are looking at something that only Gothita can see.

Gothitelle.description: They can predict the future from the placement and movement of the stars. They can see Trainers' life spans.

Gothorita.description: According to many old tales, it creates friends for itself by controlling sleeping children on starry nights.

Gurdurr.description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

Haxorus.description: Their sturdy tusks will stay sharp even if used to cut steel beams. These Pokémon are covered in hard armor.

Heatmor.description: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

Herdier.description: It has been living with people for so long that portrayals of it can be found on the walls of caves from long, long ago.

Hydreigon.description: It responds to movement by attacking. This scary, three-headed Pokémon devours everything in its path!

Jellicent.description: Fishermen are terrified of Jellicent. It's rumored to drag them into the sea and steal their lives away.

Joltik.description: They attach themselves to large-bodied Pokémon and absorb static electricity, which they store in an electric pouch.

Karrablast.description: For some reason they evolve when they receive electrical energy while they are attacking Shelmet.

Keldeo.description: When it is resolute, its body fills with power and it becomes swifter. Its jumps are then too fast to follow.

Klang.description: A minigear and big gear comprise its body. If the minigear it launches at a foe doesn't return, it will die.

Klink.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.

Klinklang.description: Its red core functions as an energy tank. It fires the charged energy through its spikes into an area.

Krokorok.description: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

Krookodile.description: It conceals itself in sandstorms that Flygon whip up and waits patiently for prey to appear.

Kyurem.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionIt generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

Lampent.description: It arrives near the moment of death and steals spirit from the body.

Landorus.description: From the forces of lightning and wind, it creates energy to give nutrients to the soil and make the land abundant.

Larvesta.description: It protects itself with flame. Long years ago, people believed Larvesta had a nest on the sun.

Leavanny.description: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.

Liepard.description: Stealthily, it sneaks up on its target, striking from behind before its victim has a chance to react.

Lilligant.description: It's well liked by other Pokémon because of its beauty. The flower on its head needs constant care, or it will soon wither and rot.

Lillipup.description: This Pokémon is popular with beginners because it's intelligent, obedient to its Trainer's commands, and easy to raise.

Litwick.description: Litwick shines a light that absorbs the life energy of people and Pokémon, which becomes the fuel that it burns.

Mandibuzz.description: It's always searching for food for Vullaby. When it finds a weak Pokémon, Mandibuzz swoops it right off to its nest.

Maractus.description: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

Meloetta.description: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.

Mienfoo.description: They seclude themselves in the mountains and devote themselves to training. The form of their kicks and chops differs from pack to pack.

Mienshao.description: When Mienshao lets out a bizarre wail, you're in danger. A flurry of kicks and chops too fast to see is about to be unleashed!

Minccino.description: When its tail has gotten dirty from self-cleaning or from cleaning its nest, Minccino spends a whole day washing its tail in clean spring water.

Munna.description: It eats the dreams of people and Pokémon. When it eats a pleasant dream, it expels pink-colored mist.

Musharna.description: The dream mist coming from its forehead changes into many different colors depending on the dream that was eaten.

Oshawott.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

Palpitoad.description: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to immobilize its opponents.

Panpour.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

Pansage.description: It's good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It's kind enough to share them with friends.

Pansear.description: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.

Patrat.description: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

Pawniard.description: It follows Bisharp's orders to a tee when it attacks enemies. After slashing an opponent, Pawniard clangs both of its blades together.

Petilil.description: They prefer clean water and soil. When the environment they live in turns bad, the whole bunch will up and move to a new area.

Pidove.description: These Pokémon live in cities. They are accustomed to people. Flocks often gather in parks and plazas.

Pignite.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

Purrloin.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can't help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

Reshiram.description: When Reshiram's tail flares, the heat energy moves the atmosphere and changes the world's weather.

Reuniclus.description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

Roggenrola.description: It was found in a fissure in a layer of exposed rock. The material that makes up its body is dirt from several hundred years ago.

Rufflet.description: Known as a natural-born warrior, soon after its hatching, it will challenge its parent to a fight in order to gain their acceptance.

Samurott.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

Sandile.description: Sandile's still not good at hunting, so it mostly eats things that have collapsed in the desert. It's called “the cleaner of the desert."

Sawk.description: Tying their belts gets them pumped and makes their punches more destructive. Disturbing their training angers them.

Sawsbuck.description: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.

Scolipede.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

Scrafty.description: It taunts its opponents by spitting. It has a certain territory that it never leaves its whole life long.

Scraggy.description: It stretches its saggy skin up to its neck to protect itself. The saggier their skin, the more respect they garner.

Seismitoad.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

Serperior.description: It can stop its opponents' movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

Servine.description: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

Sewaddle.description: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

Shelmet.description: It evolves when bathed in an electric-like energy along with Karrablast. The reason is still unknown.

Sigilyph.description: The guardians of an ancient city, they always fly the same route while keeping watch for invaders.

Simipour.description: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.

Simisage.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

Simisear.description: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.

Snivy.description: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

Solosis.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

Stoutland.description: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.

Stunfisk.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionIt conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

Swadloon.description: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.

Swanna.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

Swoobat.description: Anyone who comes into contact with the ultrasonic waves emitted by a courting male experiences a positive mood shift.

Tepig.description: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.

Terrakion.description: Spoken of in legend, this Pokémon used its phenomenal power to destroy a castle in its effort to protect Pokémon.

Throh.description: When it encounters a foe bigger than itself, it wants to throw it. It changes belts as it gets stronger.

Thundurus.description: As it flies around, it shoots lightning all over the place and causes forest fires. It is therefore disliked.

Timburr.description: Always carrying squared logs, they help out with construction. As they grow, they carry bigger logs.

Tirtouga.description: Its hunting grounds encompassed a broad area, from the land to more than half a mile deep in the ocean.

Tornadus.description: Tornadus expels massive energy from its tail, causing severe storms. Its power is great enough to blow houses away.

Tranquill.description: No matter where in the world it goes, it knows where its nest is, so it never gets separated from its Trainer.

Trubbish.description: If a young Pokémon or child breathes in the toxic gas that Trubbish belches out, it could be a life-threatening situation.

Tympole.description: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

Tynamo.description: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.

Unfezant.description: Males have plumage on their heads. They will never let themselves feel close to anyone other than their Trainers.

Vanillish.description: This hearty Pokémon survived the Ice Age. It's incredibly popular in very hot regions.

Vanillite.description: When the morning sun hit an icicle, it wished not to melt, and thus Vanillite was born. At night, it buries itself in snow to sleep.

Vanilluxe.description: Vanilluxe is born when two Vanillish, half-melted by the day's light, stick to each other and freeze together in the cold return of night.

Venipede.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

Victini.description: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being's entire body will be overflowing with power.

Virizion.description: Legends say this Pokémon confounded opponents with its swift movements.

Volcarona.description: According to legends, it was hatched from a flaming cocoon to save people and Pokémon that were suffering from the cold.

Vullaby.description: Its healthy appetite leads to visible growth spurts. It often has to replace the bones it wears as its size increases.

Watchog.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

Whimsicott.description: Whimsicott doesn't live in a fixed location. It floats around on whirling winds, appearing all over the place to perform its mischief.

Whirlipede.description: It is usually motionless, but when attacked, it rotates at high speed and then crashes into its opponent.

Woobat.description: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

Yamask.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionEach of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

Zebstrika.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

Zekrom.description: Concealing itself in lightning clouds, it flies throughout the Unova region. It creates electricity in its tail.

Zoroark.description: If it thinks humans are going to discover its den, Zoroark shows them visions that make them wander around in the woods.

Zorua.description: If a normally talkative child suddenly stops talking, it may have been replaced by Zorua.

Zweilous.description: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

Aegislash.description: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

Amaura.description: This ancient Pokémon was restored from part of its body that had been frozen in ice for over 100 million years.

Aromatisse.description: It devises various scents, pleasant and unpleasant, and emits scents that its enemies dislike in order to gain an edge in battle.

Aurorus.description: The diamond-shaped crystals on its body expel air as cold as -240 degrees Fahrenheit, surrounding its enemies and encasing them in ice.

Avalugg.description: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.

Barbaracle.description: When they evolve, two Binacle multiply into seven. They fight with the power of seven Binacle.

Bergmite.description: It blocks opponents' attacks with the ice that shields its body. It uses cold air to repair any cracks with new ice.

Binacle.description: Two Binacle live together on one rock. When they fight, one of them will move to a different rock.

Braixen.description: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

Bunnelby.description: They use their large ears to dig burrows. They will dig the whole night through.

Carbink.description: Born from the temperatures and pressures deep underground, it fires beams from the stone in its head.

Chesnaught.description: Its Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

Chespin.description: The quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

Clauncher.description: They knock down flying prey by firing compressed water from their massive claws like shooting a pistol.

Clawitzer.description: Their enormous claws launch cannonballs of water powerful enough to pierce tanker hulls.

Dedenne.description: Its whiskers serve as antennas. By sending and receiving electrical waves, it can communicate with others over vast distances.

Delphox.description: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

Diancie.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionA sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

Diggersby.description: With their powerful ears, they can heft boulders of a ton or more with ease. They can be a big help at construction sites.

Doublade.description: When Honedge evolves, it divides into two swords, which cooperate via telepathy to coordinate attacks and slash their enemies to ribbons.

Dragalge.description: Their poison is strong enough to eat through the hull of a tanker, and they spit it indiscriminately at anything that enters their territory.

Espurr.description: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.

Fennekin.description: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

Flab\u00e9b\u00e9.description: It draws out and controls the hidden power of flowers. The flower Flabébé holds is most likely part of its body.

Fletchinder.description: From its beak, it expels embers that set the tall grass on fire. Then it pounces on the bewildered prey that pop out of the grass.

Fletchling.description: These friendly Pokémon send signals to one another with beautiful chirps and tail-feather movements.

Floette.description: It flutters around fields of flowers and cares for flowers that are starting to wilt. It draws out the hidden power of flowers to battle.

Florges.description: It claims exquisite flower gardens as its territory, and it obtains power from basking in the energy emitted by flowering plants.

Froakie.description: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

Frogadier.description: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

Furfrou.description: Trimming its fluffy fur not only makes it more elegant but also increases the swiftness of its movements.

Gogoat.description: It can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

Goodra.description: This very friendly Dragon-type Pokémon will hug its beloved Trainer, leaving that Trainer covered in sticky slime.

Goomy.description: The weakest Dragon-type Pokémon, it lives in damp, shady places, so its body doesn't dry out.

Gourgeist.description: Singing in eerie voices, they wander town streets on the night of the new moon. Anyone who hears their song is cursed.

Greninja.description: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

Hawlucha.description: Although its body is small, its proficient fighting skills enable it to keep up with big bruisers like Machamp and Hariyama.

Heliolisk.description: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.

Helioptile.description: They make their home in deserts. They can generate their energy from basking in the sun, so eating food is not a requirement.

Honedge.description: Apparently this Pokémon is born when a departed spirit inhabits a sword. It attaches itself to people and drinks their life force.

Hoopa.description: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.

Inkay.description: Opponents who stare at the flashing of the light-emitting spots on its body become dazed and lose their will to fight.

Klefki.description: These key collectors threaten any attackers by fiercely jingling their keys at them.

Litleo.description: The stronger the opponent it faces, the more heat surges from its mane and the more power flows through its body.

Malamar.description: It wields the most compelling hypnotic powers of any Pokémon, and it forces others to do whatever it wants.

Meowstic.description: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.

Noibat.description: They live in pitch-black caves. Their enormous ears can emit ultrasonic waves of 200,000 hertz.

Noivern.description: They fly around on moonless nights and attack careless prey. Nothing can beat them in a battle in the dark.

Pancham.description: It does its best to be taken seriously by its enemies, but its glare is not sufficiently intimidating. Chewing on a leaf is its trademark.

Pangoro.description: Although it possesses a violent temperament, it won't put up with bullying. It uses the leaf in its mouth to sense the movements of its enemies.

Phantump.description: These Pokémon are created when spirits possess rotten tree stumps. They prefer to live in abandoned forests.

Pumpkaboo.description: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.

Pyroar.description: The male with the largest mane of fire is the leader of the pride.

Quilladin.description: It relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators' attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

Scatterbug.description: When under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

Skiddo.description: Thought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

Skrelp.description: Camouflaged as rotten kelp, they spray liquid poison on prey that approaches unawares and then finish it off.

Sliggoo.description: It drives away opponents by excreting a sticky liquid that can dissolve anything. Its eyes devolved, so it can't see anything.

Slurpuff.description: It can distinguish the faintest of scents. It puts its sensitive sense of smell to use by helping pastry chefs in their work.

Spewpa.description: It lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

Spritzee.description: It emits a scent that enraptures those who smell it. This fragrance changes depending on what it has eaten.

Swirlix.description: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.

Sylveon.description: It sends a soothing aura from its ribbonlike feelers to calm fights.

Talonflame.description: In the fever of an exciting battle, it showers embers from the gaps between its feathers and takes to the air.

Trevenant.description: It can control trees at will. It will trap people who harm the forest, so they can never leave.

Tyrantrum.description: Thanks to its gargantuan jaws, which could shred thick metal plates as if they were paper, it was invincible in the ancient world it once inhabited.

Tyrunt.description: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. If something happens that it doesn't like, it throws a tantrum and runs wild.

Vivillon.description: Vivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

Volcanion.description: It lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It's said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.

Xerneas.description: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

Yveltal.description: When this legendary Pokémon's wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

Zygarde.description: Standard Pokédex descriptionWhen the Kalos region's ecosystem falls into disarray, it appears and reveals its secret power.

Mr. Rime.description: It's highly skilled at tap-dancing. It waves its cane of ice in time with its graceful movements.

Obstagoon.description: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

Perrserker.description: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

Runerigus.description: A powerful curse was woven into an ancient painting. After absorbing the spirit of a Yamask, the painting began to move.

Sirfetch'd.description: Only Farfetch'd that have survived many battles can attain this evolution. When this Pokémon's leek withers, it will retire from combat.
